text: The people who are crazy enough to think they can change the world are the ones who do
author: Steve Jobs

text: Knowing is not enough; we must apply. Wishing is not enough; we must do
author: Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe

text: Only I can change my life. No one can do it for me
author: Carol Burnett

text: Action is the foundational key to all success
author: Pablo Picasso

text: Motivation will almost always beat mere talent
author: Norman R. Augustine

text: In the middle of difficulty lies opportunity
author: Albert Einstein

text: Success doesn't come to you. You go to it
author: Marva Collins

text: Success is ninety-nine percent failure
author: Soichiro Honda

text: Genius is one percent inspiration, and ninety-nine percent perspiration
author: Thomas Edison

text: If you do not think about the future, you cannot have one
author: John Galsworthy

text: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing
author: Walt Disney

text: A pessimist sees the difficulty in every opportunity. An optimist sees the opportunity in every difficulty
author: Winston Churchill

text: You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream
author: Clive Staples Lewis

text: Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance, you must keep moving
author: Albert Einstein

text: Challenges are what make life interesting and overcoming them is what makes life meaningful
author: Joshua J. Marine

text: Do what you have to do until you can do what you want to do
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: It always seems impossible until it's done
author: Nelson Mandela

text: Our greatest weakness lies in giving up. The most certain way to succeed is always to try just one more time
author: Thomas Edison

text: Setting goals is the first step in turning the invisible into the visible
author: Tony Robbins

text: Don't watch the clock; do what it does. Keep going
author: Sam Levinson

text: Success is going from failure to failure without losing your enthusiasm
author: Winston Churchill

text: A man is happy so long as he chooses to be happy
author: Alexander Solzhenitsyn

text: Great works are performed, not by strength, but by perseverance
author: Samuel Johnson

text: Success is the child of audacity
author: Benjamin Disraeli

text: Build your own dreams, or someone else will hire you to build theirs
author: Farrah Gray

text: There are no shortcuts to any place worth going
author: Helen Keller

text: Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success
author: Herman Cain

text: I am not a product of my circumstances. I am a product of my decisions
author: Stephen Covey

text: You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough
author: Mae West

text: Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: To improve is to change; to be perfect is to change often
author: Winston Churchill

text: Fall seven times and stand up eight
author: Japanese Proverb

text: All our dreams can come true, if we have the courage to pursue them
author: Walt Disney

text: If you can dream it, then you can achieve it
author: Walt Disney

text: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

text: Go confidently in the direction of your dreams. Live the life you have imagined
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: Whatever the mind can conceive and believe, it can achieve
author: Napoleon Hill

text: There is only one thing that makes a dream impossible to achieve: the fear of failure
author: Paulo Coelho

text: Too many of us are not living our dreams because we are living our fears
author: Les Brown

text: Don't be pushed around by the fears in your mind. Be led by the dreams in your heart
author: Roy T. Bennett

text: Our greatest glory is not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall
author: Confucius

text: Everything you've ever wanted is on the other side of fear
author: George Addair

text: Your time is limited, so don't waste it living someone else's life
author: Steve Jobs

text: In order to carry a positive action we must develop here a positive vision
author: Dalai Lama

text: Most of the important things in the world have been accomplished by people who have kept on trying when there seemed to be no hope at all
author: Dale Carnegie

text: Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things you didn't do than by the things you did
author: Mark Twain

text: We don't develop courage by being happy every day. We develop it by surviving difficult times and challenging adversity
author: Barbara De Angelis

text: Learn from the past, set vivid, detailed goals for the future, and live in the only moment of time over which you have any control: now
author: Denis Waitley

text: Only those who dare to fail greatly can ever achieve greatly
author: Robert F. Kennedy

text: I never dreamed about success. I worked for it
author: Estee Lauder

text: Believe in yourself! Have faith in your abilities! Without a humble but reasonable confidence in your own powers you cannot be successful or happy
author: Norman Vincent Peale

text: It is better to fail in originality than to succeed in imitation
author: Herman Melville

text: Character cannot be developed in ease and quiet. Only through experience of trial and suffering can the soul be strengthened, ambition inspired, and success achieved
author: Helen Keller

text: Do not be embarrassed by your failures, learn from them and start again
author: Richard Branson

text: Though no one can go back and make a brand new start, anyone can start from now and make a brand new ending
author: Carl Bard

text: Nobody ever wrote down a plan to be broke, fat, lazy, or stupid. Those things are what happen when you don't have a plan
author: Larry Winget

text: The only way to do great work is to love what you do. If you haven't found it yet, keep looking. Don't settle
author: Steve Jobs

text: Whatever you are, be a good one
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: Don't wait. The time will never be just right
author: Napoleon Hill

text: If not us, who? If not now, when?
author: John F. Kennedy

text: Wherever you go, go with all your heart
author: Confucius

text: Do what you can, with what you have, where you are
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: Any fool can know. The point is to understand
author: Albert Einstein

text: It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it
author: Aristotle

text: I have no special talent. I am only passionately curious
author: Albert Einstein

text: Learning is a treasure that will follow its owner everywhere
author: Chinese Proverb

text: Teaching is more than imparting knowledge, it is inspiring change. Learning is more than absorbing facts, it is acquiring understanding
author: William Arthur Ward

text: Education breeds confidence. Confidence breeds hope. Hope breeds peace
author: Confucius

text: Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world
author: Nelson Mandela

text: Life is not a problem to be solved, but a reality to be experienced
author: Soren Kierkegaard
